text: Hernán Eduardo Pinto Miranda (17 January 1953 – 29 July 2020) was a Chilean lawyer, politician and member of the Christian Democratic Party (PDC). He was the Mayor of Valparaíso from March 1990 to March 1992 and again from 26 September 1992 until 6 December 2004. In 2009, Pinto ran for the Senate of Chile, but lost the election. Pinto ran for Mayor of Valparaíso, in 2012 and lost the election. On 3 July 2020, Pinto was hospitalized in Viña del Mar, for respiratory failure caused by COVID-19 during the COVID-19 pandemic in Chile. Pinto died in the hospital from the infection on 29 July 2020, at the age of 67. ==References== Category:1953 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Chilean mayors Category:Chilean lawyers Category:People from Valparaíso Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Chile Category:Deaths from respiratory failure
title: Hernán Pinto
